title: Missing folder in Thunderbird but present on email provider's site.
content:
I've ignored a particular top-level folder for about a year. The folder contains both subfolders and individual emails. Just now I wanted to open it again, but it's not in the sidebar. It is in its expected place in the sidebar on the website of my email provider. Restarting Thunderbird doesn't help. I've no idea how to diagnose this.

MacOS 13.4.1(c) Thunderbird 102.13.1
creator: brec

title: "Sending the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to the Outgoing server (SMTP) timed out. Try again.'
content:
I use TB102.13.1 on a windows notebook windows 10 22h2 build 19045.3208. Since a couple of days, without any settings change, TB fails to connect to the outgoing server, and doesn't ask for the password. The settings of the outgoing server haven't changed, the password hasn't changed, I can log in manually on the account of the outgoing server,

The smtp addres is correct The port is 587 The Username is correct The authentication method is Normal Password The connection security is starttls All of this has worked perfectly for years...

so please explain me how to get TB out of that loop.... Thanks
creator: DECREMM

title: I'm not being able to send emails using outlook 365 corporation account
content:
Are there any news regarding the post below? Thanks

Important: Thunderbird 102.7.0 And Microsoft 365 Enterprise Users January 17, 2023 Jason Evangelho 50 responses Update on January 31st:

Weâ€™re preparing to ship a 2nd build of Thunderbird 102.7.1 with an improved patch for the Microsoft 365 oAuth issue reported here. Our anticipated release window is before midnight Pacific Time, January 31.
creator: erodcruz1

title: i lost all my thunderbird account info including my entire sent files..is there any way to restore?
content: i hit a wrong button and deleted 15 years of thunderbird including all my sent files..is there any way to retrieve...cabonite could not help...thxs
creator: shawno1

title: Thunderbird is freezing up?
content:
Since the last update my Thunderbird keeps frizzing up and I have to use Task manger to close it and then open it again. This happens all the time! I need this email program to work right.

Thanks Bob Williams
creator: williams382

title: TB 115 search issues
content: TB upgraded to 115.0.1 this morning, (although PCMatic has been telling me this had happened yesterday). Now I find that Search (Ctrl-Shift-F) no longer gives consistent results, and never end searching.
creator: mozillarob519

title: Connection to gmail.com too slow
content:
I have posted up to yesterday requests for help with Thunderbird to both mail.gmail.com and to Thunderbird. Part was solved by gmail but they said that for slowness to contact Thunderbird. I got a notice things were solved and this morning both the pop.gmail.com (downloading posts with Thunderbird) and the smtp.gmail.com (sending posts with Thunderbird) were fast as usual - few seconds. I sent about 35 posts and only the first took two second. This evening the sending posts from my Thunder bird (of the desktop computers - 10 posts during an hour) take about two minutes. Sending from the smartphone take a second.

Dr. Ilan Shalif (86) [removed email from public]
creator: ilan.shalif

title: Installing lastest Thunderbird 115
content: I downloaded the last version of Thunderbird using OS Ubuntu 22.04 LTS. I can't get past ./configure. "not found" I'm disappointed that I finally made a donation. Ron
creator: swamp.rh

title: How to opt out of Thunderbird Beta
content:
Hi there,

I'm needing assistance to figure out how to opt out of Thunderbird Beta

Please advise

Thanks, Mike
creator: MikeFridge

title: missing"send" button on reply to messages
content: read above message please.
creator: weldit76

title: Search does not work in TB 115.0.1 with CardBook enabled
content: When Cardbook is enabled, the search (CTRL+K) lists results, but when I click on any individual search result there is just a blank tab. It works fine if Cardbook is disabled.
creator: mail1790

title: Search does not work in TB 115.0.1 with CardBook enabled
content: When Cardbook is enabled, the search (CTRL+K) shows results, but when you click on one an empty tab is opened. It works fine if Cardbook is disabled.
creator: mail1790

title: How add to repository?
content:
Hi.

I can't find information how add new Thunderbird 115 to repository.

https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/115.0/appeal/

Thanks for answer.
creator: piotrbujakowski

title: Default cursor Position in Thunderbird "Reply"
content: In Thunderbird 115, each time I want to reply to a message, the cursor defaults to the "Search For" box under address book contacts. In previous versions, it went to the message pane where I could start the reply message. How do I fix this? Thank you
creator: jrjohnsn

title: Thunderbird "Certificate key usage inadequate"
content: Our self signed Exchange certificate was renewed yesterday and since then when I try to send an email, I get a message that says "Certificate key usage inadequate for attempted operation. The configuration related to [Exchange server IP address] must be corrected. " Our IT people have tried everything they can think of to make it work, but we still can't send emails." It is only Thunderbird that can't send emails. Emails are being received with no problem.
creator: elgodmom

title: Import MBOX to T-bird 115
content: Most of my old mails are stored in a MBOX file (previously gmail). I would like to import them. The import/export NG tool is not compitable with version 115. Any other add-on doesn't work. The normal import function of T-bird can't handle a MBOX file directly. Importing the zip won't work. How can I get my old mails imported?
creator: bbotman

title: gmail problems
content: I cant send emails to gmail
creator: mecqbt

title: Change gmail password on Thunderbird
content:
I needed to change my gmail password. I went to Saved Passwords and changed the password on the account--I id'd the account by old password. However, I'm still getting the error message: The STAT command did not succeed. Error getting message number and sizes. Mail server pop.gmail.com responded: [AUTH] Invalid credentials.

The account was not an oauth account which has a password I don't recognize. Also, the associate smtp record has a different password.

How do I change the password? Do I need to change the smtp password also?

thanks carol
creator: calsea

title: how do i remove the two horizontal dashes automatically added by Thunderbird to my HTML e-mail signature?
content:
Dear Mozilla/Thunderbird supporter,

I have just invested in a beautiful email signature from a graphic designer, but Mozilla places this before the signature: -- How do I remove these two lines? I have found an online tutorial, but this seems to be on another version of Thunderbird with a different menu structure: https://www.calzadamedia.com/knowledgebase/kb308/removing-the-signature-separator-in-mozilla-thunderbird/ I would be grateful if you could help me with this. title: autoconfig
content:
Hello,

I am currently facing difficulties with the automatic configuration of the Thunderbird mail client. I have set up a web server that provides an XML file containing the configuration information, accordingly to what we can see here -> https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird:Autoconfiguration:ConfigFileFormat, and the URL of the file is accessible without any problem from my host. However, when I try to configure Thunderbird to automatically retrieve the configuration, it doesn't seem to send an HTTP request to the server. I used wireshark to see what happens here and I can see a DNS request for autoconfig.mydomain and a response with the correct IP, but no HTTP request after that. I used the log console of thunderbird and I get those messages : mail.setup: guessConfig failed: Impossible de trouver un serveur

Here's what I have checked so far:

The configuration XML file has been validated and does not contain any syntax errors. The URL of the XML file is correct and accessible from a web browser. No proxy settings on my system. No firewall rules seems to be blocking my system to access autoconfig. Despite all these checks, I still can't resolve the issue.

If you have encountered a similar problem or have any ideas about what might be causing this behavior, I would greatly appreciate it if you could share them.

Here are some additional details that might be helpful:

Operating System: Windows 11 Thunderbird Version: 115.0.1 (also tested on 102.5.1) The configuration XML file is accessible at this URL: http://autoconfig.<mydomain.com>/mail/config-v1.1.xml?emailaddress=<username>@<mydomain.com> Error message in the Thunderbird error console: "mail.setup: guessConfig failed: can't find a server"

Thank you in advance for your help !
creator: Tarann

title: Recipient's "encrypt-only" S/MIME certificate deemed not valid by Thunderbird
content: My Thunderbird version at the moment is 102.13.0 (64-bit) running under Linux but the issue is not limited to either this particular version, nor the OS - colleagues running Thunderbird on Windows boxes report the same thing. We deal with an organization which issues their own S/MIME certificates. For a long time it worked flawlessly - we imported their CA as trusted, imported personal certificates of email recipients and everything worked smooth. Lately they started issuing two different certificates per person - one for signing emails, another for encryption. And now since emails from them come with a signature created with a certificate which has "Digital Signature" and "Non Repudiation" uses - everything works fine "inbound". The problem starts if we want to send encrypted emails back to them. Even if we import the encryption certificates we get (those have only "Key Encipherment" usage) and the certificates themselves are valid in any possible way (lifetime, proper CA chain imported and so on), still Thunderbird tells us it can't find proper certificate to encrypt the message.

title: Wrong 'recieved' date on messages
content:
I recently moved quite a lot of emails into a single archive folder. Ever since, thunderbird displays some of the messages (about 10) with a wrong 'recieved' date. All other messages are correct, but these messages are displayed as recieved just now (at the time that the account is registered in thunderbird).

The problem is perfectly replicable, removing and re-adding the account to thunderbird changes nothing. Also, multiple computers show the same issue, always the same mails that are displayed wrong.

There is no problem with the metadata, it shows the recieved-date as correct.

There is probably no problem with the mail server, as other clients (Apple Mail) display all mails with correct dates.

Thunderbird is up to date, and no extensions installed.

What could possibly cause this kind of issue?

title: Message window Mail Toolbar customize buttons
content:
In Supernova (v115) on Windows 11, when I view a message by double-clicking it to open it in a new window, I can set the Mail Toolbar to visible, then right click on it and select Customize. In previous versions I would put large icon/text button up there for Reply, Reply All, Forward, Print, and Delete. Those buttons don't appear to be available in Supernova for this toolbar.

Some of them appear to be in a fixed area as buttons with text beside the icon, and this area does not appear to have any customization available. For example, I don't use the Junk and Archive buttons, so if this "button area" must remain visible in this position, I'd like to be able to customize which of these buttons are visible.

My real preference would be to not have these buttons appear where they are now (to the right of the FROM: info), but instead to be able to have them in the Mail Toolbar at the top of the window as I could in the past. See attached screenshot for clarification of the Mail Toolbar->Customize window that doesn't currently allow for Reply, Reply All, Forward, Print and Delete to be added to the top Mail Toolbar.

title: Workarounds needed for Tbird's rigid class assumptions in HTML signature block
content:
Is there a way to write my own HTML signature block without having to contend with T-bird's moz-class wrappers' rigid assumptions in order to display what I need?

Yes, I can do what I want using T-bird templates, but I'd rather be able to simply press "Write" or "Reply" and have my signature block(s) appear the way I need them to.

Here's what I have:

In Account Settings ->Manage Identities -> Composition & Addressing I've set -Automatically quote the original message when replying -When quoting "start my reply above the quote" -And "place my signature below my reply (above the quote)"

(This is the aesthetic I want, whether or not it's a "standard email convention" hard-coded into T-bird)

The existing moz-class behaviors are:

1. When initiating a message with "Write": The "-- " appears as the first line the signature block text The signature block text follows as expected. (This is OK) Adding a "BR" tag at the end created a blank line between the signature block and the quoted text worked as expected. (OK)

2. Replying to a message using "Reply": The signature block appears _WITHOUT_ the "-- " and the quoted text follows my signature block as expected. (NOT OK)

Adding a "-- " to the HTML code cause the "-- " to appear _as expected_ as the first line of the signature block. (This worked as expected: The "-- " was put back as the first line of the signature block). (OK)

The added "BR" tag (as above) continued to work as expected to create a blank line between the signature block and the quoted message text. (OK)

4. BUT-- when creating a message with "Write" button, using the _same_ signature file as above produced two lines of "-- " before the signature block text. (NOT OK)

The "BR" tag at the end continued to work as expected.

What I Want:

I'd like to disable T-bird's wrapper HTML/CSS code and simply be able to create my own simple HTML instead. I'd also like to still be able to add the active email and URL link of to my signature block without having to contend with all T-bird's hidden assumptions.

At least in MS Word one can turn off Microsoft's annoying assumptions of what users want. The same should be possible in T-birds HTML signature block.

Attached: JPEG image of one of my active html/t-bird signature files.

Possible?

Thank you for your help!
creator: jeffb4
